attributes.action: Free up NHS beds for Covid19 response by using spare private hospital capacity
attributes.additional_details: The NHS is facing the unprecedented strain of over 1,100 known cases of Covid19 (14/3/20). Talks between NHS England and private providers are already taking place. One option under discussion is sending patients to private providers for planned operations, freeing up NHS capacity for Coronavirus treatment. The Government must ensure people can still access the treatment they need and so should mandate private hospitals to work together with the NHS.
attributes.background: We urge the Government to mandate the private healthcare sector to play its part by treating non-Covid19 patients. The UK has 570+ private hospitals with around 8000 beds, which already carry out some NHS operations. We call for private hospitals to pull together with the NHS in this time of crisis.
